body:
Hey there!
Could you enable debug mode by running`set DEBUG=nodist:*` before `npm i` and paste the output here?

I can reproduce the problem. Running nodist in debug mode, it transpires, the error is not strictly on nodist's side:

```
17:54:51.783 1ms    1ms    nodist:shim - getTargetEngine: ReadFile C:\Users\Marcel Klehr\Desktop\test\node_modules\node-sass\package.json
17:54:51.831 26ms   26ms   nodist:shim - parsePackageJSON: {Engines:{Npm: Node:>=0.10.0}}
17:54:51.835 0ns    0ns    nodist:shim - Target engine found:'>=0.10.0'
17:54:51.836 61ms   61ms   nodist:shim-node - Current version spec: >=0.10.0
17:54:51.844 7ms    7ms    nodist:shim - checking 6.3.0 against >=0.10.0
17:54:51.846 2ms    2ms    nodist:shim-node - found matching version: 6.3.0
```

This means: node-sass specifies that it's able to run on any node version greater than `v0.10.0`, and nodist consequently uses the latest installed version that matches this criteria, which in this case is 6.x.

This is certainly not optimal.

I tend to think it would make sense to lock the node version for all child processes of a running node instance. So, in this case all child processes would run with 0.12.7, which was the first decision.
However, this could cause problems when you really do want to involve nodist's version chooser, e.g. when executing some shell command in your node script. So, the more conservative choice would be to just lock the node version for all descendant node instances of npm.

this is my output:

```

```

after locking down the versions of package dependencies with 
`npm shrinkwrap` the `npm install` worked
but i had to have the modules installed to lock the versions (had to remove version 5.11.1 of node and leave only the 0.12.7 to make an install after the shrinkwrap the npm install didn't fail even if i had other version of node installed).
Thanks for the help :D

@taddeusb90 Glad you got it to work somehow.

Until v0.8.3 is released with the fix for this, anyone experiencnig the same problem may find `nodist env <desired-node-version>` to be an intermediate solution for locking the node version for npm scripts.
